what: Get the PAR-Y Regions From a Seqinfo Object — parFromSeqinfo
title: Get the PAR-Y Regions From a Seqinfo Object — parFromSeqinfo

Get the PAR-Y Regions From a Seqinfo Object — parFromSeqinfo
Get the PAR-Y Regions From a Seqinfo Object — parFromSeqinfo
text: Using seqinfo object based either hg38, hg19 variations, create GRanges object Pseudo-Autosomal Regions Y chromosome build. additional mcols column called PAR indicate PAR1 PAR2

title: Get the PAR-Y Regions From a Seqinfo Object — parFromSeqinfo
Get the PAR-Y Regions From a Seqinfo Object — parFromSeqinfo
code: library(GenomeInfoDb) sq <- Seqinfo(   seqnames = "chrY", seqlengths = 59373566, genome = "hg19_only_chrY" ) parFromSeqinfo(sq) #> GRanges object with 2 ranges and 1 metadata column: #>       seqnames            ranges strand |         PAR #>          <Rle>         <IRanges>  <Rle> | <character> #>   [1]     chrY     10001-2781479      * |        PAR1 #>   [2]     chrY 59034050-59363566      * |        PAR2 #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from hg19_only_chrY genome

what: Incorporate InDels into one or more sequences — subInDel

text: Modify one sequences include Insertions Deletions

title: Incorporate InDels into one or more sequences — subInDel
code: subInDel(x, indels, exons, ...)  # S4 method for XString,GRanges,GRanges subInDel(x, indels, exons, alt_col = "ALT", ...)  # S4 method for XStringSet,GRanges,GRanges subInDel(x, indels, exons, alt_col = "ALT", ...)  # S4 method for DNAStringSet,GRanges,missing subInDel(x, indels, exons, alt_col = "ALT", ..., BPPARAM = SerialParam())  # S4 method for BSgenome,GRanges,missing subInDel(x, indels, exons, alt_col = "ALT", ..., BPPARAM = SerialParam())

title: Incorporate InDels into one or more sequences — subInDel
text: x Sequence class XString indels GRanges object InDel locations alternate allele exons GRanges object containing exon structure x ... used alt_col Column containing alternate allele BPPARAM BiocParallel::BiocParallelParam instance

title: Incorporate InDels into one or more sequences — subInDel
text: Takes Biostrings::XString Biostrings::XStringSet object moddfies sequence incorporate InDels. expected types data determine behaviour, following expectations describing function incorporate data

text: seq BSgenome, DNAStringSet, RNAStringSet XStringSet. snps GRanges object SNP positions column containing alternate allele alt_col Column name mcols element snps containing alternate allele ... Passed Biostrings::replaceLetterAt()

title: Insert SNPs into a XStringSet — subSNP
text: object class original object, SNPs inserted supplied positions

title: Insert SNPs into a XStringSet — subSNP
text: providing BSgenome object, first coerced DNAStringSet can time consuming#'

title: Insert SNPs into a XStringSet — subSNP
code: library(GenomicRanges) seq <- DNAStringSet(c(chr1 = "AAGC")) snps <- GRanges("chr1:2") snps$ALT <- "G" subSNP(seq, snps) #> DNAStringSet object of length 1: #>     width seq                                               names                #> [1]     4 AGGC                                              chr1
